metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Vectors have a Magnitude and a Direction
Vectors typically describes Motion or Force
Vectors can be written in many ways. The most common are:
content.html: Vectors can be written in many ways. The most common are:

content.text: The image to the left is a Vector .
content.html: The image to the left is a Vector.

content.text: Vectors are the building blocks of Motion
In geometry, a vector can describe a movement from one point to another.
content.html: In geometry, a vector can describe a movement from one point to another.

content.text: The vector [3, 2] says go 3 right and 2 up.
content.html: The vector [3, 2] says go 3 right and 2 up.

content.text: The sum of two vectors ( a+b ) is found by moving the vector b until the tail meets the head of vector a . (This does not change vector b).
content.html: The sum of two vectors (a+b) is found by moving the vector b until the tail meets the head of vector a. (This does not change vector b).

content.text: Then, the line from the tail of a to the head of b is the vector a+b :
content.html: Then, the line from the tail of a to the head of b is the vector a+b:

content.text: This means that vector a and vector -a has the same magnitude in opposite directions:
content.html: This means that vector a and vector -a has the same magnitude in opposite directions:

content.text: Vectors can be modified by adding, subtracting, or multiplying a scalar (number) from all the vector values:
content.html: Vectors can be modified by adding, subtracting, or multiplying a scalar (number) from all the vector values:

content.text: Vector multiplications has much of the same properties as normal multiplication:
content.html: Vector multiplications has much of the same properties as normal multiplication:

content.text: Force is a vector with a Magnitude and a Direction .
content.html: Force is a vector with a Magnitude and a Direction.

content.text: Velocity is a vector with a Magnitude and a Direction .
content.html: Velocity is a vector with a Magnitude and a Direction.
